case_vignette: A 71-year-old man comes to the physician for a health maintenance examination. Aside from occasional lower back pain in the last couple of years, he feels well. He had a right-sided myocardial infarction 4 years ago. Currently, he has no shortness of breath and has no anginal symptoms. He has a 30 pack-year history of smoking but stopped smoking 10 years ago and does not drink alcohol. His pulse is 59/min, and his blood pressure is 135/75 mm Hg. Physical examination reveals 1+ lower extremity edema. Cardiac and pulmonary auscultation show no abnormalities. There is no lymphadenopathy. His laboratory studies show a hemoglobin of 13.2 g/dL and serum protein of 10.1 g/dL. ECG shows known Q wave abnormalities unchanged since the last ECG one year ago. A serum protein electrophoresis with immunofixation is shown.
question: Which  is the most appropriate next step to establish the diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing occasional lower back pain for the past couple of years.
How old are you?
I am 71 years old.
Have you noticed any abnormal bruising or bleeding?
No, I haven't noticed any abnormal bruising or bleeding.
Have you experienced any unintended weight loss recently?
No, I have not experienced any unintended weight loss recently.
Do you have a history of any blood disorders or cancer in your family?
I don't know about any blood disorders or cancer in my family.
I see. Have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions or are you taking any medications?
I had a right-sided myocardial infarction 4 years ago, but I currently have no shortness of breath or chest pain related to my heart.
Thank you for the information. Have you had any recent blood tests or other medical evaluations done?
Yes, I had some laboratory studies done recently.

Thank you for the information. Based on the symptoms and medical history provided, as well as the recent laboratory studies, I would like to order a complete blood count (CBC) and a peripheral blood smear. These tests will help in further evaluating the cause of your lower back pain. Please consult your healthcare provider for further evaluation and management.
